metadata.title: CVE-2024-52595 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: lxml_html_clean is a project for HTML cleaning functionalities copied from`lxml.html.clean`. Prior to version 0.4.0, the HTML Parser in lxml does notproperly handle context-switching for special HTML tags such as `<svg>`,`<math>` and `<noscript>`. This behavior deviates from how web browsersparse and interpret such tags. Specifically, content in CSS comments isignored by lxml_html_clean but may be interpreted differently by webbrowsers, enabling malicious scripts to bypass the cleaning process. Thisvulnerability could lead to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks,compromising the security of users relying on lxml_html_clean in defaultconfiguration for sanitizing untrusted HTML content. Users employing theHTML cleaner in a security-sensitive context should upgrade to lxml 0.4.0,which addresses this issue. As a temporary mitigation, users can configurelxml_html_clean with the following settings to prevent the exploitation ofthis vulnerability. Via `remove_tags`, one may specify tags to remove -their content is moved to their parents' tags. Via `kill_tags`, one mayspecify tags to be removed completely. Via `allow_tags`, one may restrictthe set of permissible tags, excluding context-switching tags like `<svg>`,`<math>` and `<noscript>`.

criterions.comment: lxml-html-clean package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
